intro: Eriostemma davaoense, commonly known as the Davao eriostemma, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
